intro: Helictotrichon jahandiezii, commonly known as the Iranian needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand arid and high-altitude conditions. Helictotrichon jahandiezii plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
